What’s more, randomized controlled trials—the gold standard in scientific research—have not shown a significant increase in cancer risk from red meat consumption. These trials are rare because they take years and require large sample sizes, but when they have been done, they haven't supported the idea that red meat is a major driver of cancer.

In short, red meat is a natural, nutrient-rich food that has been part of the human diet for thousands of years. So, if you enjoy red meat and are eating it as part of a healthy lifestyle, there's no need to be alarmed. Just like with anything, balance and moderation are key.
